website_summaries.verdict: This pet door may not be perfect, but it does address security issues. We recommend buying the newest upgrade available. Accommodates pets up to 100 pounds.
pros: Uses RF collar to identify pets and lock/unlock flap
Installs easily on most door types
cons: Older versions have electronic recognition issues
Lock mechanism makes very loud noise after opening

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for Greyhounds!
customer_reviews.text: This product is not suitable for greyhounds, whippets, or other breeds with long tails. The door is very rigid plastic and as the dog goes through, the door snaps shut on the tail. This resulted in serious injury and a $100 vet bill (see photo). I reached out to the company but there is no way to modify the door to make it safe for use. The company refuses to refund. The door was ordered on April 30 but it wasn't installed until just recently, and the return window for Amazon on this product is only 30 days so I am SOL.
customer_reviews.author: Jodi T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect dog door for keeping out raccoons...
customer_reviews.text: Works great. We had a problem with raccoons getting through the dog door. So far this door has worked out great. It took a little time for our dog to figure out the procedure of getting through the door but had it down by the first day.
customer_reviews.author: C. Sheely

customer_reviews.title: Junk if you live in cold weather
customer_reviews.text: It was ok to install (god forbid things are't 100% lined up) and dog was 90% trained to use it... then winter came. Door is a waste of money.. As soon as it got cold (we are in midwest) door malfunctioned. locked unlocked on its own. We changed batteries, did ALL the troubleshooting, only to find that the hinge on the door has frost on it. Keeps resetting and needing to relearn. Very slow and sluggish. This product does NOT do well with cold and has been rendered useless. It would be nice for company to respond with some options, as we have not even had it installed for 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: mariao

customer_reviews.title: Installation was not horrible. Biggest problem
customer_reviews.text: BUYER BEWARE!!! I had high hopes, despite other neg reviews. Pay attention! Do not waste your money. Install was easy enough. Then, 2 days later, the batteries died. So I switched it to 'unlocked', which means I should have gotten a regular dog door, save the expenses and wait time for delivery. Now, just a month old and the hinge is broken, the dogs got locked out. Great! So I go to Lowe's, get a $78 regular dog door, get it home. Guess what?! The petsafe door is so big, no other door will fill the hole. Now I need a new door to cut a hole in for my new regular dog door. Horrible experience.
customer_reviews.author: Aall Bright

customer_reviews.title: Awesome door - Lock is too LOUD
customer_reviews.text: Bought the expansion pack for the wall, what a ridiculous piece of plastic. Make sure you buy sealant for all the connections. Love this door, was able to set the sensitivity where I wanted. Only downside is the lock is so ridiculously loud! The pups wake up at 4:15 and then walk in front of the door over and over again so I hear a loud BANG, and then the hum of the motor. Not a happy camper. Can’t just put the door in lock mode cause they are still puppies and will pee, can’t leave it in open mode cause I have a cat. Fix the lock noise!
customer_reviews.author: Mama

customer_reviews.title: Keeps indoor cats in, wildlife/burglars out, and dogs free.  Cons but... WE CAN'T LIVE W/OUT IT!
customer_reviews.text: It is phenomenal! Keeps indoor cats in, wildlife/burglars out, and dogs free. Despite the cons, WE CAN'T LIVE W/OUT IT! PROS: Large (for Rotti/Shephard mix) Sturdy (for frequent, hard use) Secure (Keeps indoor cats in, wildlife/burglars out) Easy to use Very convenient Manufacturer service (offered troubleshooting, then 50% off new product) CONS: High battery usage (replace 4x D-Cell frequently). Keeping unlocked during day will slow this (we did for 2yrs) After 5 mo's in Auto setting in day (lock in night), started progressively malfunctioning (locking in open or shut) By 6 mo of Auto setting during day, Internal malfunction required resetting in AM to open and PM to locked.
customer_reviews.author: Lee & Sue

customer_reviews.title: Epic Garbage
customer_reviews.text: This is the biggest, most epic piece of garbage we have ever purchased. The transmitters don’t work. And their battery covers randomly fall off. The door won’t stay in the wall. We bought an additional piece for it - a wall extension - that was supposed to fix this (for an extra 100 bucks) and that didn’t work. The door has fallen on my Pets multiple times and now they refuse to go near it. We can’t even put back our old pet door because the hole in the wall is so large. So now they poop in the closet. Just don’t do it.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Daspit

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy design
customer_reviews.text: Just ordered our third one of these! Only because the hole in the door is a custom size. We don't use the electronic part, because it malfunctioned almost immediately, and our dog has not been trained with it. She and her friend have now successfully broken the second one. The plastic clips that hold the metal rod on the top of the swinging door are CHEAP AND START TO BREAK ALMOST IMMEDIATELY! I would love to see this design flaw fixed!! If you haven't installed this in a door, DON'T BUY IT! I'm sure there are better products out there.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy S

customer_reviews.title: Allow extra time to train pet re: locking mechanism :)
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to install. Despite that, my friend cut the hole in the TOP of the door instead of the bottom! So we called the dog, "Kiva, the Circus Dog" for awhile! We made the second "hole" and there was plenty of space between, the initial space may become a window, not exactly sure. It's been a fun adventure. Another cautionary tale, I did find the existing collar with the 3-4 dog tags was an interference, so I got her a new collar, just putting the device on it, solo for now and that caused the sensitivity of the door to work perfect, then just left me to train the dog. I'm extremely happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: C. Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Why bother?!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very sad that, although I spoke to the company about this product and what my purpose was, they lied about how it functions. This door is great if you just want to let dogs /cats come and go at will but why use the expensive magnets?! I have 3 dogs and 3 cats. I wanted the dogs to be able to come and go but not the cats! The door unlocks and swings back and forth many times as well as stays unlocked for about 45 seconds after magnet is not detected. That gives my cats plenty of time to figure out how to follow the dogs! Argh!
customer_reviews.author: lzbn69

customer_reviews.title: Horribly designed, I still can't get it to work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this months ago. II still can't get it to work. It's permanently stuck in locked mood EVEN THOUGH it shows it SUPPOSE to be unlocked. Putting in batteries is horrible. Who uses batteries in 2020 like this? Ever heard of lithium rechargeable battery pack? How to set it up was created lazy engineers who couldn't see through the idea of making a product easy to set up and it doesn't work! Fire the engineers who came up with this idiotic designed door. WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.author: O. Tye

customer_reviews.title: Proprietary Battery is a Deal Breaker.
customer_reviews.text: The door makes noise when the dog approaches which has scared my little pooches such that they hesitate to approach. They’ll probably get used to it. What’s really bad about this is that the manufacturer has made the batteries for the collar tags a proprietary model that you have to get from them. That really ticks me off. They could have just used a simple 2032 lithium battery, but no. You’re stuck buying their super expensive replacements for life. Just pure greed. Had I known this before I purchased I wouldn’t have. Bad bad business.
customer_reviews.author: WebGuy

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept, bad execution
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for the auto lock feature. Door is hard to program; in fact it still isn’t programmed, so it’s in the unlocked mode. The door is too heavy for the pup to push open with her head, so I have to open it for her which defeats the purpose of having the door in the first place. It can’t be returned since it’s already install. Huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Phyllis F.

customer_reviews.title: A Couple Little Complaints but Overall Great
customer_reviews.text: This door is great, it does exactly what it claims, but I do have a few small complaints: the sensor is a little finnicky, but it could have to do with the door placement in relation to walls and appliances (it's near a washer & dryer, could affect signal) the battery that came with my original unit was dead, but I had ordered extras at the same time so I was able to use one of those. even when unlocked it has some initial resistance to opening (from the magnets I think) that makes it tricky for dogs to get used to at first Other than that it has been perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Karate

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper, but also junk
customer_reviews.text: This worked decently for the tag that came with it, but only with it. I wasted a lot of time trying, researching, and talking with their support to find the second tag wouldn't link. Thus a replacement ordered. Same result. End of the story is sending this whole thing back as the piece of junk it is and ordering a better pet door. If you just need one tag it may work for you, buy be aware that better options are out there even though it costs a bit more. Be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No app support, but door is solid
customer_reviews.text: I have a lot of mixed feelings on this door... if you thought you could get an app option to track your pets, that is no longer available with the Per Safe doors as of March 2019. We installed the door and got it all ready, but then called the warranty/ customer service team and they confirmed that the app is no longer live... our dogs are getting a hang of the door still, but aren’t fans of the loud click noises it makes to unlock. Install wasn’t too bad. We were able to utilize the template and a jigsaw while keeping the door on its hinges (we couldn’t get the hinges to come apart in all honesty).
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY IT if you like money!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT PURCHASE THIS PRODUCT! It has been an awful mess and I'm out nearly $1000 between buying a new door, paying a guy to install it, and buying this piece of junk. First off, the lock is extremely loud. It has scared my dog so bad she won't even go near the door now. I have to physically carry her outside to potty. Second, the installation is impossible. It took forever. Third, the little radio frequency tag that unlocks the door is HUGE for a small dog. It pulls down on her collar. I'm so disappointed in this product. I hope others don't have to find out the hard (and expensive) way like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Beau M Harkness

customer_reviews.title: Not sure about it
customer_reviews.text: We purchased our first door and had the builder install it for us while building our new house, it stopped opening about two years after we bought it. The door cut out is much larger then most conventional doors and we did like the locking mechanism so I purchased another door this time I made sure the door was sealed properly. The first door motor no longer turning to lock or unlock the door. Took it apart and noticed lots of dirt around the plastic parts put new batteries in and watch the motor could not make the parts turn. Time will tell
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ruskin

customer_reviews.title: Useless
customer_reviews.text: Installed this door to keep the cats in while allowing the dogs to go out. We set the sensitivity to the highest setting, meaning the dog has to be right next to the door in order for it to open. And it does open when the dog is right there. It also opens constantly at random times, when the dog is on the other side of the house. And it's LOUD. So if you have loads of extra money, don't care that the door is unlocked most of the time and enjoy hearing a loud CLUNK, weeeeeeee, CLUNK noise all day long, then buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as described!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and better than expected. I needed to keep cat inside but let the dog go outside. Easy to install, works exactly as described. I installed it four weeks ago, dog figured out in a few days that the loud 'click!' means she can go through. It is hilarious, if sadistic fun to watch the kitten try to get out when the dog is able to do so! I had doubts as to if this would work, but zero problems in the install and no issues at all!!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Honestly wish I could give it -1 star
customer_reviews.text: We bought this door for the first time in spring of 2019. We loved it at first, but our dog broke the first one within a few months. We took the blame, and bought a second one. Well, it is February 2020 and the new door is broken so we feel that we should not have to take the blame for TWO faulty, broken damaged doors. Customer Service will do nothing for us. Terrible service in general. Hoping to find something comparable but things are not looking well in that front. Incredibly disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Kaila

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money!
customer_reviews.text: I finally installed this damn thing. Its terrible! is incredibly noisy, takes forever to lock because it uses a motor to drive gears to lock it, dog has to hug the damn thing for it to recognize he's there and the battery is a screw job! you have to throw it away and buy their crap. DON'T BUY! this is crap! I could have done better with a magnetic lock. Now I have to find something that fits in the stupid hole I made that doesn't suck!
customer_reviews.author: AndyHouston

customer_reviews.title: Lock is inconsistent. You cannot depend on it letting your pet out.
customer_reviews.text: This product is so frustrating. It works for a while, then all of the sudden my dog is standing near it whimpering b/c it has decided not to unlock for a while. Other times (e.g, 2a.m. - I find it reapeatedly locking and unlocking itself when my dog is asleep 3 rooms away. It has been worse than useless b/c now my dog is anxious about it and we've had accidents. I gave it 2 starts only b/c the customer service was polite & tried to help even though they couldn't.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Good but the unlock noise sucks
customer_reviews.text: This thing installed in a couple hours. I had a wall installation. There seems to be a loud popping noise when it unlocks that scares the crud out of my dog. Subsequently she has had several accidents in the home. I am curious if that noise is normal or I have somehow installed it wrong. I like the product. I am still trying to adjust sensitivity as well so it unlocks when my dog tries to come back in. That of course is hard when she doesnt like to go near it. I will post again once she begins to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Freedom and peace of mind for us and our fur baby
customer_reviews.text: Possibly the best thing we installed for our senior black lab. He is 13 years old and certainly can’t hold his bladder like he used to. My husband cut a hole in the door and installed a ramp he built on the other side to make it easier for a big dog to go in and out without having to drop a lot because of the ledge in our garage. It has been our sanity saver. We use it with and without the locking mechanism.
customer_reviews.author: Ro

customer_reviews.title: Failed after 9 mos.
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works great! When it fails, could be disastrous. My two cats use it relatively easily but sometimes I like to lock them in. I just changed the batteries thinking that the previous batteries just wore out quickly but brand new batteries also don't work. It's unlocked and the mode selector doesn't work. There is no light. I purchased in Oct. of 2019 (~9 mos. ago) so I will seek help from seller.
customer_reviews.author: tuneplayer

customer_reviews.title: Great door
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my sister's dog who is getting on in age and having a harder time not going potty while my sister is at work. It's taken her a few tries (first time ever using a dog doors) and she still isn't quite sure about it. For example: she stood in the rain for a long while instead of coming in (which she did 5000 times earlier in the day). So good door, wasn't bad to install, a bit big for her though (she weighs 70ish pounds and is a lab mix) but overall we are very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jena Freyermuth

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: We have two large dogs, both are Weimaraners. A few months after installing the door, one dog ran out and the plastic around the hinge broke. Trying to get in touch with customer service is a nightmare. So, we bought another door (because of the size of this, no other doors would fit into the hole that was cut in our wall). This door has been installed about a month. The same thing happened. My husband is handy when it comes to fixing things. It works, but not right. I'd try calling customer service, but who has time to wait for hours to talk to someone?? I'll be better off looking for a different type of door.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Died after 10 months DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This thing ran just under a year and absolute ate up betteries and then the unlock mechanism won’t function it just spins and never unlocks so now I have a dog door that’s stuck in the lock position....oh and when the batteries die and they will the door auto locks so if the batteries die and your loved one is outside well they are stuck until you come home not good especially in hot climates
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Works great for two years.
customer_reviews.text: After the second year this door stopped working! Buying a different brand is not an option because I would also have to buy a new door. The pet door just stopped working it refused to close when new batteries were installed. I researched the troubleshooting online but none worked. The door started making a loud clicking sound and then jump to the closed position (red light) but it wasn't closed or locked. My only option is to purchase another one because the hole that is cut in our door will only fit this PetSafe door.
customer_reviews.author: Gertiemae

customer_reviews.title: Great product but the dog hated it
customer_reviews.text: This would have been the perfect solution for my senior husky (we also have several cats we didn't want running around outside unsupervised). We recently bought a home and thought this would help him get a little more independence while keeping the kitties indoors. Everything installed easily and worked exactly as the instructions indicated. However, the clicking noise this thing makes might as well have been as loud as a gun shot. It scared the bejesus out my dog to the point he wouldn't even go near the door. Great product, but if you have a senior or otherwise tepid/skittish/overly sensitive dog, don't bother. You'll end up retraining them which door to use for bathroom time.
customer_reviews.author: diana brockett

customer_reviews.title: Nice doggie door
customer_reviews.text: This door makes a good seal to keep out winter weather. My old one had a flexible flap which became worn and bent and allowed too much warm air to escape the basement. The only problem I've had is that my dog would jump up on the door and press the lock button, run outside and he'd be locked out. I took the batteries out and use it like a manual door and it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Door closed on dogs tail - hard plastic
customer_reviews.text: We ended up returning this. The "door" is very hard plastic and it kept hitting/pinching my dogs tail so he was scared to use it. We also got the smaller door (he is a 12 ld dog) but it still seemed like a tight squeeze for him. We never got around to testing the lock function because he became too afraid to use the door, but the dongle that is supposed to go on his collar looked like it was going to be a bit big for wearing all the time. (PS manufacturer should invent a door that literally opens like a garage door when the dog is near - that would be really cool!)
customer_reviews.author: Amy B. RIVERA

customer_reviews.title: GIANT doggy door
customer_reviews.text: This was cumbersome to put together. Took 2 people and like 3 hours. The alignment of the screws on the corners was exceptionally hard to obtain. The automatic collar feature is SO SLOW. Unless your dog DOESN'T fly out the door or is super slow when exiting the house, this door is functional. Our pooch smashes her face into it because the lag, so we leave it off... basically, a small child or teen could totally obtain access to our home through the door. So could a snake, opossum, strays, and a medly of small animals. I'm glad we can lock it though... should we want to open the door every 15 minutes to let the dog in and out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No replacement parts sold anywhere for large size
customer_reviews.text: We have had this door for close to 2 years. We alive the door but the hinge broke off as the plastic pieces that hold the rod in place have broken. The company itself only sells a replacement for the small not the large. The dimensions of the whole are so large that we cant find another door by the same company or different company to fit. So we either have to get a whole new door and dog door that has more options for replacements should we need to replace again or buy a whole new large size of this dog door.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Fimbres

customer_reviews.title: Very secure but loud
customer_reviews.text: Works surprisingly well. Locks in place very securely, however I dropped one star for the loud "bang" it makes when unlocking...made training my nervous dog much more difficult because the noise would freak her out and she would run off and the door would re-lock just in time for her to gather her nerve to try again, resulting in an endless cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Chatterjee

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE - Revised up to 4 stars a year later - Fine but it drained batteries here's why....
customer_reviews.text: Started out great for first 3 months and gave it 2 stars because it drained batteries very quickly. The seller asked that we contact them. They said we needed to adjust the sensor since our dog's favorite spot is so close to the door. (We can hear the door try to click open when he plops down.) That's given us a better understanding of why it drained the batteries While we still have to replace the batteries every few months, it is because the dog likes to sit near the door when he's watching us have dinner. We can take off his collar when there is a large gathering and there is no issue.
customer_reviews.author: SewSparkle

customer_reviews.title: Great for big dogs!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly for my huge dogs. I have a Newfoundland and a large black lab each weighing it over 100 pounds each. No problems wit size. The Newf figured it out first within an hour and turned it into a revolving door so to speak. The lab is old and doesn't like to push the door open with his nose or head so he gets the Newf to go first so it is swinging first. Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Mellissa Brinkschroeder

customer_reviews.title: Large for Lab
customer_reviews.text: Great product, got it for a lab puppy. It is super big and there is no question that an adult lab can use it. Make sure you order 4 d batteries or a 6v power supply. Update: easy to added a plug in adapter and wifi controller. Found I was mostly leaving it unlocked unless we were not going to be home for a while. Now it locks every night.
customer_reviews.author: Reef_slacker

customer_reviews.title: Beware if buying for a wall
customer_reviews.text: For those wanting to install this in a wall — beware as there’s no easy way to do it. The company wants to sell you an additional flimsy piece of plastic for an extra hundred dollars – oh, and if your wall is a bit thicker you’ll have to get an extension for that as well for even more money. We think we can rig a way to install it without those pieces, but it will take some ingenuity and a trip to the lumber store. Will update when/if that happens. Just hoping the door works once it’s up.
customer_reviews.author: C. Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: It works great. Right now we are trying to get our dog to go in and out. He’s learning. We haven’t tried the automatic collar yet. Just him going in and out. The small is pretty small. Our dog barely fits. He’s a small 13 pound terrier mix. You don’t want any bigger that that for this door. After two days, we already love it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Williams

customer_reviews.title: Affordable solution for easy house training!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a contractor so it was a 20-minute install for me. Trace the template on the door. Drilled a hole. Cut along the line with a skill saw. One half goes on the outside the other half goes on the inside tighten a few screws and it clamps together. Cindy Lou who. was a rescue shelter dog. Permanently 75% housebroken. This door got her the other 25%. Thank you so much 💕
customer_reviews.author: John P.

customer_reviews.title: Cats for sale, cheap.
customer_reviews.text: I can't dial down the sensitivity enough for it to not be always unlocked. My solution is to just leave it unlocked and I lock it when I leave the house. Dog is free to go out and the cats aren't strong enough to open it. They hate the dog with a passion, so I don't have to worry about them trying to slip out when my pooch comes in or heads out. Anyone interested in 2 evil cats?
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: This is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say I have never used nor installed a dog door. I am a single grandma and was able to install the door by myself in about 30 minutes. It fit perfectly without a hitch. Secondly my 10 year boxer had never used a door either but he was trained in less than a week. It does make a slight clacking noise but I adjusted the sensitivity and that worked great. It is exactly what I have been looking for and honestly can not say enough good things about this door!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Compromise
customer_reviews.text: This is a large door and my little dog had some trouble getting used to it. We had a small door too and compared to this one it uses a lot of batteries and is not always reliable to let them in and out. However, if you are like us and have a small and med. sized dog this door is a nice compromise. I do not miss coming home to a wet floor.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndi H

customer_reviews.title: This product is HORRIBLE!!
customer_reviews.text: I installed this product in December 2019. The installation process was not hard. The product itself is awful!! I've bought a number of batteries as the batteries fall out so easily, leaving the dog confused as the door will not open and therefore they have accidents. I've even gone so far as to purchase new FAB's to see if the one that came with the product was defective and didn't hold the battery in properly. Every time the battery falls out you have to reprogram the product and 50% of the time, it won't reprogram. So, so disappointed especially after I took the time to install this dog door. I would NOT recommend this product to anyone!!
customer_reviews.author: Annette W. Avery

customer_reviews.title: Broken door hinges and difficult to program
customer_reviews.text: The plastic door broke at the hinge point at the top of the door after six months of limited use. Could only get one smartkey to program and open the door. Second key just wouldn't program. Will contact Customer Service tomorrow to see if they will honor one year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: D. Daniels

customer_reviews.title: I like mine
customer_reviews.text: The hinge on my old one broke so I bought another one. The new one is much better, the sensitivity is really strong, I had to turn it down to 25% so it would not stay open all the time in auto. I hope this one lasts longer. Note: if you buy one and it appears to open and closes by itself take the battery out of the smart key to see if it makes a difference, if so turn down the sensitivity down. This thing is so sensitive that will pick up a signal from another room. Really!
customer_reviews.author: J. Brillinger

customer_reviews.title: Woops!  We wasted our money on this one
customer_reviews.text: My man spent most of the day, taking down our back door and re-cutting a hole for the NEW cat door. Our sweet kitty was getting un-invited guests or at least one cat that was frightening her. The door is noisy when it's in active mode and she won't go near it. So there is no security as we have to leave it turned off all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Nan

customer_reviews.title: Bought: 2. Failed: 2, both after 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: Have bought two of these, both have failed within 3 months. And man do they go through batteries! A set of 4 D cells lasts about a month, then two months later the whole thing dies. I’m going to try one more time, as the hole has already been cut to size. But this is a drag.
customer_reviews.author: Miffedone

customer_reviews.title: So LOUD
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this one star based on sound. It sounds like a bat is hitting our door every time the hung unlocks. When it locks, it's quiet and smooth; when it unlocks, you'd think it was ungluing itself from the door and popping loose. We'd take it off and return it but it was such a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: HeatherRiley

customer_reviews.title: Too slow to unlock
customer_reviews.text: My dogs have used a doggie door for years but I had to go to this kind of door to keep my cats in the house. The problem I am seeing is that it takes so long for the door to unlock that my dogs won’t or can’t wait for it to happen. I have the sensitivity turned up as high as I can but it just takes too long!
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Fuller

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the kitten in.
customer_reviews.text: My old dog door had a rubber flap, and my new kitten quickly learned how to go through it. This door has a hard plastic flap which swings noisily- scaring the kitten, until it magnetically clamps shut. My kitten can not push through the magnetically shut door. I haven't even activated the electronic opening part yet, but I will need to if the kitty gets braver and manages to push through it.. For now it has solved the problem for which I purchased it.- keeping the kitten from escaping. It seems to be well made and sturdy. I'm very happy with this purchase..
customer_reviews.author: Debra J. Kern

customer_reviews.title: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.text: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. We paid $156.19 for this in April of 2016. The mechanism that raises and lowers the door into a locking position broke. Now the dogs can go out but they can't come in. The plastic hinge is also visibly broken. We have two medium sized cattle dogs. We are very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and then read the reviews on it. So it sat in closet for weeks until I decided to install it two days ago I came home to dog poop in the bedroom and I was ready to cut my door open. It Was a little harder to install in steel door but it wasn’t the fault of product. Once installed it works great. I am very pleased with product. I do wish the sensor in collar was better quality but it works just fine. Total project time was 1 hour
customer_reviews.author: Brian C.

customer_reviews.title: Breaks easily
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd door in less than 2 years. The first one lasted almost the full 2 years. The 2nd one broke in less than 2 months. The flap isn’t what’s breaking. It’s the raise and lower mechanism that keeps breaking. This means that you can’t replace any part. You have to purchase a whole new dog door.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Kinsey

customer_reviews.title: Perfect door for my mastiff
customer_reviews.text: This is a sleek, modern look. It is large enough for a 110lbs mastiff. The dog had used a non-locking, flap style door as a puppy and quickly adapted to the new door. I am very pleased with it and would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: James Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Came with faulty key
customer_reviews.text: The key that came with ours doesn’t work. We thought maybe the battery was dead but we got a new battery and it still doesn’t work. It’s pretty hard for the animals to get thru once unlocked. I was thinking it opened by itself but they have to push a decent amount and it’s loud when it shuts
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Farrand

customer_reviews.title: would strongly not recommend this seller
customer_reviews.text: did not come with the pet key and no way to get a hold of the seller!! also already had a dog door and was expecting this to fit as the measurements were the same then realized the only measurements were for the flap and not the actual size of the door cut out, all this can be fixed on my end but a little pricey to be misleading on theirs. would strongly not recommend this seller! also realized all the hard ware is also missing when trying to install... would really like this seller to contact me
customer_reviews.author: Kasey

customer_reviews.title: Just and FYI...
customer_reviews.text: For the most part the door was amazing. Easy open close, sensor worked. However the door flap part kept getting cracked and we had to replace the whole door several times (3 to be exact) because once the top of the door dog flap is cracked or the teeth get out of line, the door doesn’t want to operate the way it should. If there ways a way to just rebuy the flap part and not the whole door we would have hiven it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel L

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cat owners
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of not reading the reviews for this product. My main issue is the key itself. For cats and other smaller animals, its comically huge and creates an unsafe choking hazard for animals with its large size being easily snagged. Another issue is the door not being compatible with other RFID key fobs, so that you cannot even replace the massive key with a 3rd party device. Finally the fact that the battery is built into the key and must be purchased again when dead creates a serious issue with long time use and economic feasibility. If youre purchasing this for a cat, i cannot recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: The noise the device makes when unlocking makes the cats jump. Somehow they can be standing right in front of it and it won’t unlock, yet they can be inside four feet away and then it will unlock. The batteries on the door and one of the collars has already gone bad, in two months.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like it but it needs a cover to keep cold air out.
customer_reviews.text: This works well. We did not end up using the collar unlocking items. The door is pretty rugged and works well. Does not open when the wind blows. I have one problem with it. At night when we have it locked it lets cold air in through holes in the hinge. It needs a snap on cover for when the door is locked and not in use.
customer_reviews.author: John E. Giese

customer_reviews.title: Door did not work, customer service poor
customer_reviews.text: We received our door and decided to test it out before cutting a hole in our door. Lucky we did. We added batteries per their instructions, but it wouldn't recognize the smart key. I emailed Customer Service with my information. They quickly responded the next day. I followed their instructions several times, but still could not get the door to operate properly. I re-emailed Customer Service the next day. But did not receive a reply. Two weeks later sent another email stating my dissatisfaction with their service. But still no reply. I am highly disappointed. This door received great reviews, but our experience with their Customer Service has left us looking for a different door.
customer_reviews.author: ab in Indiana

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts for just over a year x2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this door. It worked pretty good for about 13 months then broke. I called the company and even though it was out of warranty they sent me a new one for free. Now it is been just over a year since I received the replacement one and that one is now broken. They did offer to sell me another new one for $116 but I am going get a regular dog door. Before this door I bought a different brand for $350 but the collars on that one were definitely not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy B.

customer_reviews.title: Best Pet door
customer_reviews.text: Step by step instructions. Easy installation & came with the wall conversion kit which was $98 extra else where. We have the door unlocked, ours dogs are learning to use it before we lock and use the smart keys which 1 came with the door and bought an extra from amazon. The door seems very sturdy and strong and secure. the door itself is very hard plastic couldn't be opened on lock unless you were extremely forceful and trying to break.
customer_reviews.author: SoupytheMedic

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our needs!
customer_reviews.text: I love this pet door! It was super easy to install, which I did myself. I am fairly skilled with simple carpentry. My dogs, a chiweenie and poodle terrier mix, figured it out fairly quickly. The only complaint I have is that I wish there was a smaller key option for smaller dogs. But I knew there wasn't, so I'm not docking a star for that. All in all, it's a nice door. Very pleased I got it!
customer_reviews.author: hrhinson

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Include Smart Key
customer_reviews.text: Seems great in theory but does no good without the parts. For such an expensive piece of plastic they should include all of the parts required for operation as well as the batteries. I can't even open the door until I go get the batteries needed to try and test it. Don't know how I'll manage to do that when it didn't come with the smart key to open it... I'm so upset because I've already cut out the hole in my door so I can't send it back. Make sure all the parts are there before you start cutting holes in your house.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Plastic should be a factor
customer_reviews.text: My problem with this door is the plastic pieces that attach to the lowering mechanism. They break easily and are not replaceable. I have replaced the door 3 times so far. Being that it is a cut to fit finding another door the same size is difficult. But if this 150 dollar door breaks again I will just buy a new door and start over. Just to be clear I do have energetic dogs, that are large breads. You should consider this when making impact items.
customer_reviews.author: Damon Howard

customer_reviews.title: Keeps undesirable critters out. The noise is barely noticeable.
customer_reviews.text: For elderly bedridden mother’s little dog since she can’t get up if no one is there to open door. We caught four possums, one cat, and one coon (Yes, living in populous city) when we had regular doggy door, that got in (Eeeek!) This keeps the undesirables out now. Do have to change batteries in the door often during winter months.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Hunt and Connie Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Door it self is nice. The tags taking 10 seconds to unlock are ...
customer_reviews.text: Door it self is nice. The tags taking 10 seconds to unlock are unreasonable. Should be seeing to make time variable. I have to kick the sensitivity way up to keep the dogs waiting so long, now it unlocks 10 feet away. One dog just walks up and stand next to door, stares though window for a while then walks in.the other won't mess with it at all. But it does keep the cat from going out
customer_reviews.author: r willard

customer_reviews.title: Heavy door pops smaller dogs in the head and their head can get stuck.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well built door... I have a medium size dog and a small dog... My issue is that the door has some weight on it. so when my larger dog goes out and the small dog follows, she gets popped in the head rather hard. When the little one goes out first, if she doesn't go quickly, her head can and has gotten stuck. Also, that loud pop noise scares them every time. They should get over this in time... I will update my review if things change.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Perkins

customer_reviews.title: having a dog door is nice, but the reality of this one isn't better than a non-electric door.
customer_reviews.text: Dog learned how to use this door quickly on the 'open' setting, and the 'automatic' function seals out drafts when it works right. Problem is that the dog isn't quite sure about the 'automatic' setting, in part bc it doesn't always work. Sometimes she's standing there for several minutes before it engages & opens. Also the battery bottom fell off of the electronic key about a week after putting it on the dog's collar, so the door is currently stuck in 'open' mode. Not a bad dog door, but you might as well save $ and get one that isn't electronic.
customer_reviews.author: LKL

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but not great for big dogs
customer_reviews.text: This door works really well, it locks great and if u set up the radius correctly u wont have any problems. But, i have replaced this door twice now, and currently we have fixed the door itself that it no longer locks. this door is not well suited for larger, stronger dogs. we have one that just plows into the damn thing, and takes it off the track/hinges inside the door. but if u have gentle dogs, this should work out great.
customer_reviews.author: Fizzybean

customer_reviews.title: Perfect doggie door
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. It’s heavy enough that I don’t have to use the sensor option . I got 2 dogs and a cat . German Shepherd and Chihuahua. Main reason I bought this product is because my cat is an indoor cat and I needed a doggie door heavy enough that if my can touches it or played with it , it won’t open and my dogs have easy way out to the yard . This door is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: K. Dimm

customer_reviews.title: Weight of door too heavy.
customer_reviews.text: It’s not working out for my two small dogs, 14 lb size. Door is too heavy to push open, they get hit by heavy plastic door and it’s scared them, so they don’t use t....most likely my husband will ne returning it...very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Angelface

customer_reviews.title: Big and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: The dog can finally go out the door as its big enough for his 104 pound bulk. However the 8 pound cat can’t push it open. Our 18 pound cat does just fine. Still haven’t figured out how to make the auto open function work. I guess you have to program the chips and that isn’t a priority to figure out just yet. It’s a bit noisy and the heavy door swings to a stop.
customer_reviews.author: Tani Rae Standridge

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly ... and LOUDLY!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fine way to allow your dog to get in and out at will. Installed as described and works with the "keys" provided. It did take a while for the dogs to get used to the WHAM noise made as the thing opens up. The unlocking move is done with a solenoid which slams the door upward and unlocks it from the bottom groove. Solid locking and easy to go through. But I must admit that it's been a while since we actually USED the electronic lock/unlock function. We just leave the dogs come and go at will ... assuming there will be no small burglars who notice the door is essentially wide open all day and night!
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected, but meets our needs
customer_reviews.text: The door was easy to install, and works well to prevent critters other than our dog from entering our house. Training was a little challenging - our dog was terrified for the first week because the door is noisy. It makes a loud “THUNK”, followed by a mechanical whirring as the flap releases, and again when it locks. Now that she figured it out, and stopped being scared, she uses it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: DC

customer_reviews.title: VERY NOISEY!!
customer_reviews.text: The unit is very noisy. If the dog goes out at night the loud "CLACK" WAKES EVERY ONE IN THE HOUSE! Also the transmitter lost a bat asap! This product could easly be one of the best on the market with just a couple little design changes but seems to be aimed more at selling batteries for the transmitter. Junk don't buy it unless it is for your garage or other out building.
customer_reviews.author: flyers

customer_reviews.title: Great door,  dog gets out,  cats stay in! Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This is great! It only took our little dog a few days to get the hang of it and it works just as it should, dog gets out, cats don't. Easy to install if you're comfortable measuring and cutting a hole in a solid core door. The door flaps a bit as it closes and locks which is unavoidable noise, but it's totally worth it for us, and we're really happy we decided to give this a try.
customer_reviews.author: Christy H.

customer_reviews.title: Works as is described
customer_reviews.text: The dog door I got works with both unlocking from the inside and unlocking from the outside. I got a small door for my 12 lb Part chihuahua and part Schnauzer...however, my dog is refusing to learn to use it right now. She still insist we get up and 'open' the door to let her out. Who knows, maybe someday!
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: Not good for cats or skiddish dogs who have long tails
customer_reviews.text: In Theory this door should work fine, but for cats (or skiddish dogs) it is not good because the door slams back shut too quickly with the magnets and traps their tail. Design defect. Why even have the magnets?
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Garbage! False triggers unless the sensitivity is all the way down and then doesn’t open all the time. Requires a giant hole to be cut and then non other doggie door can be used to replace this. Total overpriced junk!
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Dog Door
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Electronic SmartDoor that we have had. It is a lot quieter than the other one and works great. We only lock it at night so the critters can't come in while we are sleeping. Great door.
customer_reviews.author: Janice E. Gehrlein

customer_reviews.title: Not what you think.
customer_reviews.text: Product it self is great for a single animal home. It unlocks for them and locks when they walk away.unfortunately it takes atleast 30-60 seconds after they walk away to start locking. Allowing other animals without a key to get through. Had high hopes because of the price but unfortunately it has had issues you wouldnt think you would have to worry about. Unfortunately it has cost me more than its worth. I do however love petsafe the brand and use there other products
customer_reviews.author: Aj

customer_reviews.title: " but like others I've experienced the key not activating despite sensitivity ...
customer_reviews.text: Works okay. I was excited to use this door for our pup with having the peace of mind that he could have a "key," but like others I've experienced the key not activating despite sensitivity changes or the door locking by itself. You might be better off getting a manual. The size was perfect for our 65-70 pound Dalmatian....and my niece (5) and nephew (4).
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't do without
customer_reviews.text: Bought mine 2 years ago and it still works great for my 2 dogs. They use it all the time. Having the dog door that leads out to our fenced in back yard has changed my life. Only complaint I have is battery life. The batteries only seem to last a few months.
customer_reviews.author: orangetriangle

customer_reviews.title: Test with your dog before installing
customer_reviews.text: I wished I had tested this with my dog before installing. Maybe my border collie is too smart. She refuses to try to go out a solid door. She had no problem going through the old doggy door with the plastic flap. To her, the solid door is a window. We both miss the benefits of her being able to go in and out on her own. I kept trying to get her to use it and I allowed the return window to go by.
customer_reviews.author: Casey

customer_reviews.title: This item is great for the price
customer_reviews.text: This item is great for the price. We made the mistake of not ordering the kit that goes with it if you are going through a wall, but we managed to get it to work for us. The only other problem we are having is the fact that the door is hard plastic and 2 of our dogs don't like to push it open with their faces (Shih Tzus). We hope with time that will not be an issue. We are still very pleased with this item. Be sure to order extra "keys" if you have more than one dog. Great value!!!
customer_reviews.author: bgjones

customer_reviews.title: Eats batteries
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this door is great, but I have had it installed for only about 4 weeks and I have already gone through 16 D size batteries for this door. It goes through the batteries so fast when it is set on the automatic setting that It really isn't that useful. I should have gone with a regular dog door that had a manual lock. I would have been cheaper and actually done what it advertised without costing an additional fortune. :(
customer_reviews.author: Krisie

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dog door. Only mail issue is unlocking tag. It's a little large for out 7 pound dog. Its does continue to lock and unlock on own. Never figured out why so that is a concern. Other then that i recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Denney

customer_reviews.title: Flap would not release, contacted PetSafe to get assistance ...
customer_reviews.text: Flap would not release, contacted PetSafe to get assistance, after going through some set-up procedures a new door was sent our way under warranty at no cost. PetSafe service was impeccable. When things go wrong, and sometimes they will, the way a company responds is what is most important, and where customer service comes into play. Problem solved, what more can you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Lee K.

customer_reviews.title: Works just like you would hope!  Our dog loves it and it seems very durable.
customer_reviews.text: The dog loves it. It scared him at first but now that he is used to it, he shoots through. It unlocks quickly and has a bit of a delay on relocking. We have a cat that always wants to try to come in. He has been caught by the tail because it started locking when he was sneaking through! He doesn't try it anymore because it hurts. We're very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: retired military

customer_reviews.title: It was so annoying that we now have a very expensive electronic door ...
customer_reviews.text: I didn't expect the door to be so noisy every time it locks and unlocks. We have three dogs, and every time one of them gets anywhere near the dog door (not to go out, just meandering by), the door whirrs and clicks. It was so annoying that we now have a very expensive electronic door that we keep turned off. It's also very, very large. The small size was too small, and the large is too large. I wish they made a medium size.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne M.

customer_reviews.title: Flies through expensive batteries/ Broke off hinge easily
customer_reviews.text: Dog broke the cheap plastic hinges very quickly...so now I just have a hole in the side of my house for skunks and raccoons to explore if they desire. It also went through "D" batteries extremely quickly. For the amount of money, the company should have at least used a hinge that could support a dog going through it.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: just too easy! The only almost complaint I might have is ...
customer_reviews.text: We installed this door about a month ago, mounting it in a storm door going from the dog yard to the mud room. Our dog loves having free access to his yard. I would never have it any other way, just too easy! The only almost complaint I might have is a strong wind can hold it open after the dogs goes thru & prevent it from latching, But I wouldn't let that keep me from having it. Yes, I recommend this product & I would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would it a 3rd time
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time I've purchased this door. The first last 2yrs. I replaced it due to my dogs, I have 2, trying to go out of it together too many times and race their way inside. It was still intact but on its last leg (letting air escape and loud when used) so I replaced before it compeletly broke.
customer_reviews.author: Brr0731

customer_reviews.title: This thing burns through D cell batteries. It works ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing burns through D cell batteries. It works ok. Took weeks to get the sensitivity close, but sometimes it still wouldn't open til the dog went away and came back. We got a new dog that went through kinda hard, door only lasted 3 more weeks after that. Now that there's a giant hole in my door, i got it to lock one more time and caulked around it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Idleman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Item
customer_reviews.text: My friend bought this door for her pit bull and she took to it right away...so when I got a dog I knew I would buy one too. But it is a very good choice for security and ease of your animal.
customer_reviews.author: michelle mcmenimen

product_meta.title: PetSafe Electronic SmartDoor - Collar Activated Dog and Cat Door - Small to Large Pets
product_meta.description: Size:Large Door with SmartKey| Color:WhiteThe PetSafe SmartDoor allows you to control your pet’s access. When the SmartDoor is set to Automatic mode, only your pets wearing the SmartKey can pass through the SmartDoor. As your pet enters the range of the SmartDoor, the SmartDoor detects the SmartKey and unlocks automatically. The range is adjustable up to 3 feet. After your pet passes through the SmartDoor, the door will lock automatically helping to keep the house pets in and outdoor animals out.
feature_bullets: CUSTOMIZE YOUR PET’S ACCESS: The SmartDoor features programmable selective entry, exit and auto-locking options
PEACE OF MIND: The SmartDoor works with the waterproof SmartKey worn on your pet's collar; only the pets wearing the SmartKey can go in and out
MULTIPLE PETS: Great for households with multiple pets; programmable for up to 5 SmartKeys
BATTERY OPERATED: The SmartDoor is battery operated (4 D-Cell Batteries, not included)
DOOR INSTALLATION: Designed for installation in interior/exterior doors; wall installation option available with purchase of Wall Install Kit
PRODUCT SUPPORT: PetSafe brand's U.S.-based Customer Care experts will be glad to help; call Monday through Saturday at 1-800-845-3274
EXPERIENCE: PetSafe brand has been an industry leading U.S. manufacturer of pet behavior, containment and lifestyle products since 1991, helping millions of people and pets each year

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
